page.title: 20SHEERNESS IN OUR HISTORY
page.content:
SHEERNESS DOCKS WERE LAID OUT BY {SAMUEL PEPYS}WHO VISITED THE TOWN SEVERAL TIMES AND MENTIONED IT IN HIS DIARY. PEPYS AVENUE BEARS HIS NAME. {LORD NELSON}WAS A FREQUENT VISITOR TO THE TOWN AND STAYED AT THE ROYAL FOUNTAIN HOTEL. HIS BODY WAS LANDED HERE AFTER TRAFALGAR. IN{1797}RICHARD PARKER LED A MUTINY WHICH HELPED FORCE SOME REFORMS IN THE NAVY ALTHOUGH PARKER WAS "HANGED AT THE YARDARM" IN SHEERNESS DOCKYARD.
ST.GEORGE'S CHURCH OF ENGLAND MIDDLE SCHOOL. YEAR LEADER MR.B.RISDON CLASS 2H TEACHER MISS J. HOLMES CLASS 2M TEACHER MISS S. MUNN CLASS 2W TEACHER MRS E. WOOLMINGTON
